meanings.sent1: Her egomanias made it difficult for her to consider other people's feelings.
meanings.sent2: His constant egomanias made it hard for him to see beyond his own needs.
meanings.sent3: At the party, his egomanias were so obvious that everyone found it amusing.
meanings.sent4: In a room full of diverse opinions, his egomanias stood out like a bright light.
meanings.sent5: The egomanias of the famous actor were the talk of the town.

meanings.definition: The condition of being excessively self-absorbed or self-centered.
meanings.sent1: The egomanias of the celebrity were evident in every interview.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't see past her own egomanias to understand the perspectives of others.
meanings.sent3: Despite his egomanias, he managed to make everyone laugh with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her egomanias were like a heavy cloak, weighing her down in social situations.
meanings.sent5: The politician's egomanias were a barrier to building genuine connections.
